questions.title: Question 1 for Class 191002
questions.main: The strongest winds in a hurricane are found:

mcq.option: A) at the center of the storm
D) at upper levels, above the center of the hurricane
E) near the periphery of the hurricane

questions.title: Question 2 for Class 191002
questions.main: Which figure comes closest to the estimated number of thunderstorms that occur each year throughout the world?

questions.title: Question 3 for Class 191002
questions.main: Hurricanes are given names when the storm is in what stage of development?
questions.answer: The name is assigned when the storm reaches tropical storm strength.

questions.title: Question 4 for Class 191002
questions.main: Just before a storm becomes a fully developed hurricane it is in the ____ stage.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class 191002
questions.main: In the center of a hurricane known as the ____ the surface air pressure is much ____ than the air pressure near the outside of the storm.

questions.title: Question 6 for Class 191002
questions.main: If a hurricane with sustained winds of 100 mi/hr is moving westward at 20 mi/hr will the strongest winds and greatest damage potential be on its northern or southern side? Explain. If the same hurricane turns northward will the strongest winds and greatest damage potential be on its eastern or western side?
questions.answer: Northern side.  With the storm moving westward the north sid gets the combination of hurricane motion plus the speed of the winds blowing onshore on the north side.  On the south side winds will be off shore and slowed by friction and in a direction opposite storm motion.

questions.title: Question 7 for Class 191002
questions.main: The main difference between a hurricane and a tropical storm is that:
questions.answer: C) winds speeds are greater in a hurricane

mcq.option: B) tropical storms are more than 500 miles from the US mainland
C) winds speeds are greater in a hurricane
D) hurricanes have a clearly defined eye on satellite photographs

questions.title: Question 8 for Class 191002
questions.main: On the Saffir-Simpson scale a category 5 storm would indicate:

mcq.option: D) none of the above, the Saffir-Simpson scale applies to tornadoes

questions.title: Question 9 for Class 191002
questions.main: What are polar lows? How and where do they form? How do they produce hazardous weather for shipping?
questions.answer: Polar lows are cyclones that form poleward of the polar front. They form when frigid air from ice-covered land or water surfaces comes in contact with warmer air that was located over ice-free waters. Like hurricanes these smaller intense storms normally have a warmer central core strong winds (often gale force or higher) and heavy showery precipitation that unlike a hurricane is in the form of snow.

questions.title: Question 10 for Class 191002
questions.main: Storms that form in the tropics are given names when:
questions.answer: A) they reach tropical storm strength

mcq.option: A) they reach tropical storm strength
B) they become fully developed hurricanes
C) they approach to within 250 miles of land
D) rotation becomes visible on a satellite photograph
